title: (x) "Back to business" bold serif w/distinctive 'K' - LTR Federal {Dennis Hill}
content:
Hi - first off I’m glad I found this place, stumbled across it by accident but the whole site looks awesome! Going to be spending some time here when I can...

In the meantime I have the inevitable font ID question - if anyone can help I’d be most grateful. The ’K’ should be a giveaway... but isn’t. The ’S’ is pretty special too.

Thanks in advance - Chris

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bank.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160352/http:/typophile.com/files/bank.jpg) | 50.05 KB |

 [‹ (x) Stylish serif in CV - Palatino {Brett Jordan}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160352/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35671 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Centro de Explicações de Leiria" logo rounded geometric sans - Alba {Manlio} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160352/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35666 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Chris Cousins

comments.content:
[http://www.letterror.com/catalog/fed/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160352/http:/www.letterror.com/catalog/fed/index.html "http://www.letterror.com/catalog/fed/index.html") ?

There is also a freeware version of this type of font.

Speedy! BIG thanks for that, most appreciated.  
Should have recognised it of course... I’m not in the States buy I have seen a dollar bill before!

Here is the freeware one used in your sample:

[http://simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/unitedstates.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160352/http:/simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/unitedstates.html "http://simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/unitedstates.html")

Moderator: I hope this isn’t one of the frowned upon sites. (please let me know if it is and I’ll find another)
